title: 8(a) Set-Aside (FAR 19.8): Depot Level Maintenance (DLM) Support Services FRCSW, North Island, CA
description: Update - 4/19/22 Corrected uploaded Q&As (No. 91) dated 13 April 22. Update - 4/18/22 Amendment 0004 to the RFP has been uploaded along with revised Attachments 2, 5, 6, 20 & L-5.? Sections A, B, I, and L were revised.? Additional Questions and answers (Q&As) regarding the DLM RFP has been uploaded.? ?Solicitation due date remains May 5, 2022 at 12:00pm EDT.? All questions must be submitted on the RFP question submittal form.? Questions regarding this amendment and/or RFP must be submitted by 8:00pm EDT Monday April 25, 2022.? Questions received after the date and time may not be answered. Update - 4/7/22 Solicitation due date has been extended until May 5, 2022 at 12:00pm EDT.? The Government estimates posting another amendment around April 13, 2022. Update - 4/4/22 Amendment 0003 to the RFP has been uploaded. Solicitation due date has been extended until April 21, 2022, see block 9 of the SF33. Update - 4/1/22 Amendment 0002 to the RFP has been uploaded along with revised Attachments 2, 5, 6, 9, 15, Exhibit A, L-4 & L-5.? Also, Sections B,? I, L and M have been revised.? An additional Question and answer (Q&A) regarding the DLM RP has been uploaded. The Government will not accept anymore questions regarding this solicitation or the amendments. Update - 3/29/22 Additional Questions and answers (Q&A) regarding the DLM RP have been uploaded.?Additional Questions and answers (Q&A) regarding the DLM RP have been uploaded.? ?The Government anticipates providing an amendment to the RFP by early next week at the latest. Update - 3/17/22 The Government will not accept anymore questions regarding this solicitation after 5:00pm EDT today March 17, 2022. Update - 3/7/22 Amendment 0001 to RFP has been uploaded along with revised Attachments 5, 6, 8, Exhibit A, L-2 & L-4.? Sections B and L and clause 5252.211-9503 have been revised.? Update - 3/4/22 Additional Questions and answers (Q&A) regarding the DLM RP have been uploaded.? Proposal due date has been extended to April 13, 2022. Update - 2/24/22 Additional Questions and answers (Q&A) regarding the DLM RP have been uploaded. Update - 2/23/22 Additional Questions and answers (Q&A) regarding the DLM RP have been uploaded. All questions must be submitted on the RFP question submittal form.? All questions must be submitted by 3:00pm EST Friday February 25, 2022.? Questions received after the date and time may not be answered. Update - 2/19/22 Questions and answers (Q&A) regarding the DLM RP have been uploaded. All questions must be submitted on the RFP question submittal form. This is a follow on requirement to N68936-17-C-0081. Attached is the solicitation N6852021R0007 for the United States Navy (USN) Fleet Readiness Center Southwest (FRCSW) requirement for Depot Level Maintenance (DLM) services for augmented staffing of the Government workforce. The requirement was previously posted as a presolicitation notice under the same title but a notice ID of N68520-21-R-0007. Please use the attached excel RFP Question Submittal Form and submit all questions via email to brandi.j.firestien.civ@us.navy.mil and tiffany.l.crayly.civ@us.navy.mil with ?DLM RFP Question? in the subject line Description of the Requirement: This requirement will provide services for aircraft, aircraft engines and associated components/material undergoing Depot Level Maintenance (DLM), involving the rework of existing aviation end items, systems, and components and manufacture of items and component parts otherwise not available. This is to include modernization, conversion, in-service repair, assembly, disassembly, and all other categories of aircraft maintenance and associated business program support for Fleet Readiness Center Southwest (FRCSW). THIS ACQUISITION IS BEING COMPETED as a 100% 8(a) set-aside, based on the sources sought notice released in August 2020 (see solicitation #: N6893620R0135 for details). Anticipated Contract Type: The resultant contract is anticipated to be a single award (SA) Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) type contract with Cost-Plus-Fixed-Fee (CPFF) Level of Effort CLINs for services, and cost reimbursable CLINs for Other Direct Costs (ODCs) (Travel and Material). Individual task orders will be generated for specific DLM requirements. Anticipated Period of Performance: The anticipated period of performance is a five (5) year ordering period. Incumbent Contractor: The services are currently being performed under contract N68936-17-C-0081 by Aircraft Readiness Alliance (ARA), LLC, 1689 C St. Suite 219, Anchorage, AK 99501-5131

category_id: Equipment: Aircraft Related Bids
title: PMA-271 ?Take Charge and Move Out? (TACAMO) C-130J-30 Studies and Analysis Sources Sought
description: INTRODUCTION The Naval Air Systems Command, in support of Airborne Strategic Command, Control, and Communications Program Office (PMA-271), is seeking sources to provide pre-Milestone (MS) B engineering studies, analysis, and Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) for C-130J-30 air vehicle analysis, and system development and maturation. DISCLAIMER THIS SOURCES SOUGHT IS FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY. IT IS A MARKET RESEARCH TOOL BEING USED TO DETERMINE POTENTIAL AND ELIGIBLE BUSINESSES CAPABLE OF PROVIDING THE SUPPLIES/SERVICES DESCRIBED HEREIN PRIOR TO DETERMINING THE METHOD OF ACQUISITION AND ISSUANCE OF A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL. THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL. IT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION AND SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS A COMMITMENT BY THE GOVERNMENT. RESPONSES IN ANY FORM ARE NOT OFFERS AND THE GOVERNMENT IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO AWARD A CONTRACT AS A RESULT OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT. THE GOVERNMENT IS NOT COMMITTED NOR OBLIGATED TO PAY FOR THE INFORMATION PROVIDED, AND NO BASIS FOR CLAIMS AGAINST THE GOVERNMENT SHALL ARISE AS A RESULT OF A RESPONSE TO THIS SOURCES SOUGHT. ANY INFORMATION SUBMITTED BY RESPONDENTS TO THIS TECHNICAL DESCRIPTION IS STRICTLY VOLUNTARY. Lockheed Martin Corporation (LMCO) has been the sole designer, developer, and manufacturer of the C-130J. LMCO utilized the Government-developed C-130H and developed the C-130J. The Government procured the C-130J under FAR Part 12 until 2005 at which time all new procurements were FAR Part 15. Based on the nature of the C-130J development, any data and software that was unique to that variant was deemed commercial and developed exclusively at private expense. Any data developed for the C-130J after 2005 would obtain the license rights asserted in accordance with the appropriate Defense Federal Acquisition Regulations clauses. The Government does not possess the technical data for the efforts described herein. ELIGIBILITY The applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 336413 with a small business size standard of 1,250 employees. The Product Service Code (PSC) is AC13. Businesses of all sizes are encouraged to respond; however, each respondent must clearly identify their business size. ANTICPATED PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE The work will start 1st Qtr FY23 and will end 2nd Qtr FY24.? ? ANTICIPATED CONTRACT TYPE All efforts will be completed with cost-type Contract Line Item Numbers (CLINs). REQUIRED CAPABILITIES Requirements under this effort are to provide program management, technical support, engineering analysis, and NRE to demonstrate that the C-130J-30 air vehicle can support the TACAMO mission and determine what changes can be incorporated into the production line post the initial three (3) test aircraft. These efforts include comprehensive analyses of Block 8.1 C-130J-30 aircraft performance and operation as well as aircraft systems to develop potential design changes to continue to mature the C-130J-30 airframe performance and support integration of TACAMO mission system equipment requirements. Aircraft systems include, but are not limited to, airframe structure, electrical power system, propulsion system, hydraulic system, cooling system, flight station, avionics subsystem and architecture, landing gear, and flight control system. Analysis includes consideration of Size, Weight, and Power plus Cooling (SWaP+C) impacts to certify airworthiness. Tasking may include: Assessments of TACAMO air vehicle requirements and their impacts on the C-130J-30 through detailed engineering analysis using existing C-130J-30 source data only. Continuation of Very Low Frequency (VLF) structural analysis, weight reduction strategies, cooling system expansion assessments, and cyber and nuclear survivability to refine and provide Courses of Action (COAs) to meet the TACAMO air vehicle requirements. New studies to provide COAs based on requirements maturity to include such things, but not limited to, antenna location, co-site analysis test instrumentation, and security.? NRE to continue the development of the COAs.? All changes will be limited to existing C-130J-30 source data.???? Software development and infrastructure support related to systems and subsystems of the C-130J-30 originally developed and integrated by LMCO, including, but not limited to, avionics and air vehicle management systems upgrades, aircraft mission computer, aircraft diagnostics, avionics support and hardware upgrades to implement software updates. Support to the Government on the integration by a third party of the TACAMO mission equipment support for MS B. Effort for the above may include: Analysis of enhanced power generation systems, re-architecting the C-130J-30 electrical bus Interfacing classified mission systems with flight deck avionics systems C-130J-30 8.1 changes to address TACAMO requirements, to include autopilot modifications, and nuclear and cyber survivability mitigations Assessing fuselage, wing, vertical and horizontal stabilizer aeromechanical and structural impacts for antenna, antenna pod, and radome mounting Assessing current C-130J-30 structures, flight control surfaces impacts, and fatigue life assessments with respect to the TACAMO air vehicle flight profile? Efforts need to take into consideration TACAMO air vehicle performance, operations, and sustainment to include, but not limited to system-level performance objectives analysis, aeroloads and dynamics assessments, airframe fatigue life assessments, reliability and maintainability assessments, obsolescence analysis, supply chain visibility, and cost-effectiveness assessments. SUBMISSION INFORMATION It is requested that interested businesses submit to the contracting office a brief capabilities statement package (no more than five (5) pages in length, single-spaced, 12 point font minimum) demonstrating ability to perform the tasking listed under the required capabilities.?This documentation must address at a minimum all of the following: Company Name; Company Address; Company Business Size, and Point-of-Contact (POC) name, phone number, fax number, and e-mail address. Company profile to include number of employees, annual revenue history, office location(s), Commercial And Government Entity (CAGE) Code, and a statement regarding current small/large business status. Prior/current corporate experience performing efforts of similar size and scope to the tasking described under ?Required Capabilities,? unique to the C-130J-30 variants, within the last three years, including contract numbers, contract values, Government point of contract with current telephone number, and a brief description of how the referenced contract relates to the tasks stated above. Management approach to staffing this effort with qualified personnel. Provide either of the following as applicable:? Please note that inclusion of number three (3) above on prior/current experience does not address this request. Any existing technical data licenses of agreements with the C-130J-30 original equipment manufacturer (OEM) for performance of related tasking to include the date the agreement expires, or provided documentation, with concurrence from the OEM, demonstrating the ability to obtain any necessary license/agreement for access to required technical data for this effort in the time specified to start these efforts. Supporting documents submitted in response to this requirement will not be counted against any page limitations. Demonstrate that your company possesses the necessary technical data.? For clarity purposes, this request is for disclosure of the data with any necessary substantiation of your company?s ability to perform the tasking above without any technical data provided by the Government or LMCO. Supporting documents submitted in response to this requirement will not be counted against any page limitations. Company?s ability to comply with security measures for the protection of the TACAMO mission by having personnel and computer systems to support classification up to Top Secret (collateral) access. Specific technical skills your company possess which ensures capability to perform the tasks. If you are a small business, provide an explanation of your company?s ability to perform at least 50% of the tasking described in required capabilities. Respondents to this notice must also indicate whether they are a large business or qualify as a Small, Small Disadvantaged, Small Disadvantaged Veteran Owned, Small Business Women-Owned, 8(a), Hub Zone or Service Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business Concern. ? Your response to this Sources Sought, including any capabilities statement, shall be electronically submitted via email to Mr. Christopher Rawlings at Christopher.a.rawlings.civ@us.navy.mil, Ms. Monica Card at Monica.l.card.civ@us.navy.mil, and Ms. Louise Joy at louise.m.hartshornjoy.civ@us.navy.mil, in either Microsoft Word or Portable Document Format (PDF).?The deadline for response to this request is 4:00 p.m., Eastern Time, 4 May 2022. All data received in response to this Sources Sought that is marked or designated as corporate or proprietary will be protected. In order to protect this information if you would like to submit this via encrypted email please contact the above at least one business day in advance prior to submission to coordinate the means for submission. Information and materials submitted in response to this request WILL NOT be returned. Classified material SHALL NOT be submitted. No phone calls will be accepted.? All questions must be submitted via e-mail. The Government is not committed nor obligated to pay for the information provided, and no basis for claims against the Government shall arise as a result of a response to these Sources Sought.

If the Government determines that budget and resources are available, a formal RFP will be released for the subject requirement.?The final date to submit advanced questions regarding the Draft Solicitation will be: 1400 hours,?2 May?2022?via e-mail, to?Charles Johnson?at?charles.w.johnson6.civ@us.navy.mil?and?Garrett Douglass at garrett.w.douglass.civ@us.navy.mil.??E-mails MUST contain the following in the subject line: "Q&A for PMA-261 Depot Mods?Industry Day Round Two",?Telephone inquiries will not be accepted. Interested parties are encouraged to the greatest extent to submit questions in advance, due to the limited amount of time for questions during the event. The Government will not hold one-on-one discussions.? In anticipation of the upcoming requirement, a Technical Library (TL) of information containing data that may be useful to potential offerors will be available to all interested companies.? ?TL information will be provided to assist in understanding potential?performance requirements, physical design and integration constraints, and technology needs.? Interested companies may begin submitting the below required information.? The Government POCs for this Special Notice are?Charles Johnson, charles.w.johnson6.civ@us.navy.mil and Garrett Douglass,?garrett.w.douglass.civ@us.navy.mil.??Please refer to the announcement number above when responding to this notice.? To request TL access, contact the Government POCs via email with the following company information:? a. Company name? b. Company point of contact (POC) name, phone number and email address ? c. Current and valid CAGE number/Central Contractor Registration (CCR) number? d. A statement as to whether the company is registered by the Department of Defense, United States/Canada Joint Certification Office (i.e., have a DD 2345 approved by said agency).? e. Unclassified mailing address? f. Facility Security Officer POC name, phone number, and email address? If multiple company sites require access to the data, provide information requested in items a - g for each additional site.? Original Posting:? Background:??PMA-261?CH-53?Depot Level?Modifications?Indefinite-Delivery/Indefinite-Quantity (IDIQ) Contract?includes?effort to perform non-recurring and recurring efforts required to fabricate, assemble, and support prototyping/system integration/installation of Engineering Changes to aircraft designated by the H-53 Program Office, PMA-261.? To support this requirement, NAVAIR intends to compete this effort as a?small business set-aside. This effort will be formally solicited under one Request for Proposal, which will result in a?Single Award?IDIQ Contract.?? NAVAIR intends to conduct a hybrid in-person and virtual?Industry Day session on?7?December 2021?in Lexington Park, MD?and via Microsoft Teams.??The purpose of this industry day is to provide our industry partners an avenue to learn about?the planned effort?and to collect any written questions that prospective?offerors?may submit through the course of the industry day.??? Due to current COVID guidelines, there is a limit of?48?people who can?attend in person.??Each potential?offeror?will have a limit of?people that can attend in person.? In-person attendance will be accepted on a?first-come-first-serve registration basis.??The number of attendees per potential offeror will?be determined based on the?number of potential offerors whom?RSVP.??The remaining attendees are welcome to attend virtually via?Microsoft Teams.??? There will be a separate room for 1-on-1 sessions if a potential offeror is interested.??The potential offeror will be responsible for having its own telephone conference line?for virtual 1-on-1 sessions, or if there are some team members in-person and some virtual.??? Attendance on Industry Day is not a requirement and in no way affects any company from submitting a proposal in response to any forthcoming solicitations. The Industry Day for this requirement will only address information related to the PMA-261CH-53 Depot Level Modifications?IDIQ.??Further, prospective?offerors?do not have to attend the industry day in order to?obtain presentation materials or submit questions.??All information presented at the industry day will be made available to prospective?offerors?via the internet at?https://www.sam.gov, where questions can also be submitted electronically.??The PMA-261?Depot Mods?will be listed under?N0001922R0044.???? Please register for?this?Industry Day, pursuant to RSVP requirements listed below.?? The Industry Day e-mail responses must include a subject line titled:??"PMA-261?Depot Mods?Industry Day Registration".? Industry Day information is as follow:? Date:?????December?7, 2021?? Time:?????0800 Check-In? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?0830 Start? Place:????22290 Exploration Dr? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?Boyington Rm? ? ? ? ? ? ?? Lexington Park, MD 20653? RSVP:????NLT 1200 EST,?2 December?2021?to?Charles Johnson???charles.w.johnson6.civ@us.navy.mil,?Garrett Douglass -- garrett.w.douglass.civ@us.navy.mil.?? ? With your RSVP provide the following information:? ???? -Name of Business? ???? -Address of Business? ???? -Cage Code? ???? -Attendee(s) Name? ???? -Point of Contact? ???? -Telephone Number? ???? -Email Address? ???? -Indicate Large or Small Business? ???? -Permission to distribute Company contact information? ???? -Company's areas of related expertise? ?????? Additional Industry Day information including directions, required documents, agenda, questions forms, and ground rules will be provided by e-mail to those firms who RSVP as instructed above.? The documents included in this Industry Day Notice are not to be considered?a?RFP or Invitation to Bid.? The documents provided are solely to be used to understand the Government?s?intent in procuring the subject effort.? If the Government determines that budget and resources are available, a formal RFP will be released for the subject requirement.?The final date to submit advanced questions regarding the Draft Solicitation will be: 1400 hours,?2 December?2021?via e-mail, to?Charles Johnson?at?charles.w.johnson6.civ@us.navy.mil?and?Garrett Douglass at garrett.w.douglass.civ@us.navy.mil.??E-mails MUST contain the following in the subject line: "Q&A for PMA-261 Depot Mods?Industry Day",?Telephone inquiries will not be accepted. Additional question forms will be provided at Industry Day.? The draft N0001922R0044 document does not contain?all of?the required clauses or terms and conditions as those will be determined at the time of draft RFP release.? This?draft RFP release is?expected to occur in the second quarter of FY22.?? Questions and Answers will be made available approximately two weeks after Industry Day.

description: THIS SOURCES SOUGHT IS FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY. THIS IS?NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL. IT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A?SOLICITATION AND SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS A COMMITMENT BY THE?GOVERNMENT.? RESPONSES IN ANY FORM ARE NOT OFFERS AND THE?GOVERNMENT IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO AWARD A CONTRACT AS A?RESULT OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT. NO FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO PAY FOR?PREPARATION OF RESPONSES TO THIS ANNOUNCEMENT. ANY?INFORMATION SUBMITTED BY RESPONDENTS TO THIS TECHNICAL?DESCRIPTION IS STRICTLY VOLUNTARY.?? This Sources Sought notice is being posted to satisfy the requirement of Defense?Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement 206.302-1(d). The Naval Air Systems?Command Patuxent River (NAVAIRSYSCOM) intends to award a contract for the procurement of ALE-47 Digital Sequencers, DCDU Repairs, and Technical Services. The proposed contract?is anticipated to be a single base year.? BAE Systems Information and Electronic Systems is the only manufacture who can satisfy the Government's requirements within the required?timeframe. THIS IS NOT AN INVITATION FOR COMPETITIVE PROPOSALS. This acquisition?is being pursued on a sole source basis under the statutory authority of 10 U.S.C.?2304(c)(1), as implemented in FAR 6.302-1, only one responsible source and no?other type of supplies or services will satisfy agency requirements.??This notice of?intent is not a request for competitive proposals; however, the Government will?consider all responses received to this notice. A determination by the Government?not to compete this requirement is solely within the discretion of the Government. No?solicitation will be available for this procurement. Information provided herein is subject to change and in no way binds the Government to solicit or award a contract

Attached is the solicitation N6852021R0007 for the United States Navy (USN) Fleet Readiness Center Southwest (FRCSW) requirement for Depot Level Maintenance (DLM) services for augmented staffing of the Government workforce. The requirement was previously posted as a presolicitation notice under the same title but a notice ID of N68520-21-R-0007. Please use the attached excel RFP Question Submittal Form and submit all questions via email to brandi.j.firestien.civ@us.navy.mil and tiffany.l.crayly.civ@us.navy.mil with ?DLM RFP Question? in the subject line Description of the Requirement: This requirement will provide services for aircraft, aircraft engines and associated components/material undergoing Depot Level Maintenance (DLM), involving the rework of existing aviation end items, systems, and components and manufacture of items and component parts otherwise not available. This is to include modernization, conversion, in-service repair, assembly, disassembly, and all other categories of aircraft maintenance and associated business program support for Fleet Readiness Center Southwest (FRCSW). THIS ACQUISITION IS BEING COMPETED as a 100% 8(a) set-aside, based on the sources sought notice released in August 2020 (see solicitation #: N6893620R0135 for details). Anticipated Contract Type: The resultant contract is anticipated to be a single award (SA) Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) type contract with Cost-Plus-Fixed-Fee (CPFF) Level of Effort CLINs for services, and cost reimbursable CLINs for Other Direct Costs (ODCs) (Travel and Material). Individual task orders will be generated for specific DLM requirements. Anticipated Period of Performance: The anticipated period of performance is a five (5) year ordering period. Incumbent Contractor: The services are currently being performed under contract N68936-17-C-0081 by Aircraft Readiness Alliance (ARA), LLC, 1689 C St. Suite 219, Anchorage, AK 99501-5131

category_id: Equipment: Aircraft Related Bids
title: Small Form Factor Electronic Warfare Payload
description: THIS IS A REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI) ONLY - This RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes - it does not constitute a Request for Proposal (RFP) or a promise to issue an RFP in the future. No formal solicitation package is available. All information submitted in response to this announcement is voluntary; the United States Government will not pay for information requested nor will it compensate any respondent for any cost incurred in developing information provided to the United States Government. Interested parties may identify their capability to meet all or portions of the requirements by submitting: A white paper, technical data, qualification and certification test data, logistics documentation and/or past performance data. This data must be provided to this office no later than 3:00 PM Eastern Standard Time on?May 6, 2022. Only responses received by this date will be considered. REQUIREMENTS Description: This is a Request for Information (RFI) for planning purposes, as part of a market survey on potential sources and emerging technologies in support of development of requirements and acquisition strategy for a small form factor Electronic Warfare (EW) payload integrated onto an Unmanned Aerial Platform at low, mid and high altitudes.? A copy of the draft small form factor EW payload requirements will be provided through Department of Defense (DoD) Secure Access File Exchange (SAFE) upon request.? All requests for the draft requirements must be made no later than 22 April 2022. White Paper: The Government requests that interested parties submit white papers that fully describe their system capabilities with respect to the performance levels as stated in the draft requirements in detail.? The White paper should contain: How existing production and Independent Research and Development (IR&D) systems meet the draft requirements? Cost and schedule for procuring 50 production or near production systems. What modifications and changes would be required to meet draft requirements? Cost and schedule of modifying or building a system to meet requirements, and cost of procuring 50 systems. What is the actual/projected EIRP of the system across frequency? What is the actual/projected sensitivity of the system across frequency? Limitations of HW and SW in meeting draft requirements. Suggestions to modify draft requirements. Based on the white paper submission, the Government may elect to conduct a one-on-one discussion based on its analysis of the RFI response, to include the quality of submission and level and scope of the information provided. NOTE THE GOVERNMENT IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO CONDUCT DISCUSSIONS OR REQUEST DEMONSTRATIONS, NOR IS IT LIABLE FOR ANY COSTS OR EXPENSES INCURRED IN RESPONDING TO THIS RFI. A copy of the draft small form factor EW payload requirements will be provided though DoD SAFE upon request.? The small form factor EW payload requirements are marked Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) and are controlled under DISTRIBUTION STATEMENT D.? To obtain a copy of these documents for review purposes, your eligibility will have to be verified by the Government.? At this time, this RFI is only requesting comments back from verified Cleared Defense Contractors with an active Commercial and Government Entity (CAGE) Code and at least a Secret facility Clearance Level (FCL).? The adjudication and response process is as follows: ?The interested and cleared company provides the information requested below under ?RESPONDING TO THIS RFI?. Security verifies that a valid company clearance exists in the DoD National Industrial Security System (NISS). The technical POC releases a soft copy of the small form factor EW payload requirements to the verified company POC. The company reviews the requirements and submits a white paper by 6 May 2022. Further correspondence, including questions or comments, may be initiated by the Government. RESPONDING TO THIS RFI Any interested party shall submit a white paper in response to the above?capabilities.??The white paper shall be due no later than 3:00 PM Eastern Standard Time on?May 6, 2022.??The response date denoted on?SAM.Gov?shall hold precedence.? Vendors may submit any questions related to this RFI, or the draft requirements, no later?than 22 Apr 2022.?? Response Format RFI responses are limited to thirty (30) pages, including cover and?administrative pages.??All RFI responses shall include the following:? Company name, company address, overnight delivery address (if different?from mailing address), DUNS Number, CAGE code, point of contact, e-mail address,?telephone number, and fax number.?Additionally, please state if your company is foreign owned, either directly or indirectly. Certification of business size (large or small) under NAICS code 541511?"Custom Computer Programming Services". Also provide socioeconomic?categories if a small business (i.e. large, small disadvantage, veteran-owned,?woman-owned, etc.).? Interested parties are requested to respond to this RFI in Microsoft Word?Office compatible format.??Responses shall be written using a 12 point font size or larger.?? This RFI is for planning purposes and does not constitute a commitment,?implied or otherwise, that a procurement action will be issued. No?entitlement to payment by the Government of direct or indirect cost or?charges will arise as a result of the submission of a company's or?corporation's information.? The Government shall not be liable for or suffer any consequential damage?for any improperly identified proprietary information. Proprietary?information will be safeguarded in accordance with the applicable?Government regulations and requirements.?? The Government does not guarantee that this RFI will result in a Request for?Proposal (RFP) or contract award. The Government will not provide?reimbursement for any costs incurred by vendors who respond to this RFI.??? All questions and responses relating to this notice shall be sent via email to?the below with the?Subject,?(Small Form Factor EW Payload RFI - "Your Company Name"): Mrs. Kellie Clavijo (kellie.r.clavijo.civ@army.mil), Contract Specialist Dr. Leslie Litten (leslie.a.litten.civ@army.mil), Technical POC Or mailed to: U.S. Army, PM EW&C, ATTN: SFAE-IEW-EW, Dr. Leslie Litten, 6631 Cyber St, Building 5100, Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD, 21005 To request a copy of the draft requirements, vendors should provide?DUNS Number, CAGE code, address that coincides with the CAGE code, point of contact, e-mail address,?and telephone number to the below POC NLT 22 Apr 2022: Ms. Alison T. Powell,?alison.t.powell.civ@army.mil In accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation PART 10.001, the results of?this Market Survey will primarily be used to develop the Government's?acquisition approach and will be used to determine if sources capable of?satisfying the agency's requirements exist.??This is NOT a request for proposal and does not constitute any obligation?by the Government to award a contract based on the findings from the?survey.?The Government will not reimburse interested sources or respondents to?notice, or any follow-on notice, for any costs incurred in association with this?announcement or for subsequent exchange of information.??All requests for further information must be in writing and via email;?telephonic requests for additional information will not be honored

title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Spare Parts for the AN/APR-39C(V)1/4 Radar Signal Detecting Sets
description: ***Updated SAM posting on 05 April 2022 to extend the proposal due date to 04 May 2022, update the Contract Specialist to Johnna Bursk at johnna.bursk@dla.mil, and add Amendment 0002 to solicitation SPRBL1-21-R-0022.*** ***Updated SAM posting on 03/21/2022 to extend the due date to April 6, 2022 and to add Amendment 0001 to solicitation SPRBL1-21-R-0022.*** **Updated SAM posting on 03/04/2022 to add Attachment 0008 DD Form 441** DLA Land at Aberdeen is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) SPRBL1-21-R-0022 for the purchase of spare parts to support the end system: AN/APR-39C(V)1/4 Radar Signal Detecting Sets. The proposed contract type is Firm-Fixed-Price (FFP), Indefinite-Delivery, Indefinite-Quantity (IDIQ) contract with a five-year base period and no option year periods. The proposed guaranteed contract minimum is $25,000, and the proposed maximum contract value is $25,000,000. The proposed contract is for the following supplies.? Note: The annual best estimated quantity (BEQ) listed for supplies is for planning purposes only. The BEQ listed is for years one through five. Actual annual ordered quantities may be more or less than this BEQ. NSN: 6130-01-048-5922, P/N: SM-D-877090, BEQ: 12 NSN: 5998-01-201-8781, P/N: A3084300; BEQ: 5 NSN: 5998-01-201-8782, P/N: A3084303; BEQ: 5 NSN: 5895-01-313-7749, P/N: A3084160; BEQ: 31 NSN: 6130-01-337-7801, P/N: A3084161; BEQ: 26 NSN: 5841-01-204-8266, P/N: A3084297; BEQ: 156 NSN: 5841-01-274-4939, P/N: A3099630; BEQ: 120 NSN: 5841-01-205-0658, P/N: A3084060; BEQ: 156 NSN: 5998-01-324-3465, P/N: A3084050; BEQ: 12 NSN: 5841-01-201-8644, P/N: A3083965; BEQ: 1 NSN: 6940-01-203-6173, P/N: A3084105; BEQ:13 NSN: 6940-01-203-6172, P/N: A3084102; BEQ: 1 NSN: 6625-01-274-0836, P/N: A3084100; BEQ: 5 The Government does own the complete Technical Data Packages (TDPs) for these NSNs.? Based on market research, these items are for military use only and are not commercial; therefore, FAR Part 15 applies to this acquisition.? This procurement will be a Total Small Business Set-Aside. All documents and proposals must be submitted via DoD Secure Access File Exchange (SAFE) to Melinda.Kim@dla.mil.? The URL for DoD SAFE is https://safe.apps.mil/ .? Offerors must comply with Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) markings.? Files shall not contain classified data. The use of hyperlinks in proposals is prohibited. Offerors need to have a current profile at the System for Award Management (SAM), https://www.sam.gov in order to submit proposals. Please do not wait until the last minute to submit proposals. To avoid potential submission of a later proposal, we recommend the transmission of your proposal file 24 hours prior to the required proposal due date and time. Contractors will be required to have access to classified data and SE

category_id: Equipment: Aircraft Related Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): T-45 Aircraft Protective Equipment (APE) Support FOSR/RFP
description: The Survivable Airborne Operations Center (SAOC) Program Management Office (PMO) is working toward acquiring a replacement Weapon System (WS) for the aging E-4B, National Airborne Operations Center (NAOC). Updated capability needs and operational requirements have potentially altered the viable technical solutions for SAOC. The associated requirement from the classified System Requirements Document (SRD) is available upon request to appropriately cleared companies (see instructions provided below to request draft SRD excerpt). As a result, the Government is willing to consider used commercial derivative aircraft. Additionally, the Government intends to continue to pursue a full and open acquisition strategy for the entire weapon system using a very large platform. It is anticipated that EMD will result in 2-4 modified EMD aircraft, associated ground support equipment, and a SAOC WS production design. ------------------------------------------------------- The purpose of Request for Information (WVS-SAOC-INFO REL2-006) is to solicit further information to help the Government develop the program acquisition strategy requesting?industry feedback on: Production aircraft Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD) Schedule Design technology readiness levels? ------------------------------------------------------ The purpose of this posting (WVS-SAOC-RFI3-SRD) is for the SAOC PMO to?release?a fourth draft?System Requirements Document (SRD) via classified media to interested companies holding the appropriate facility clearance. ?We are?requesting feedback from Industry on the following topics: Identification of any requirements with ambiguity or that lack the needed clarity and completeness, and any recommended changes Identification of requirements that limit design solutions or could add unnecessary risk across the program and recommended changes Missing/incomplete requirements in Section 3 of the SRD ------------------------------------------------------ The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) #4 is to provide industry with insight into the Government?s current plans in support of the SAOC Acquisition.??The Government is providing updates on the following topics. Acquisition Strategy Schedule Aircraft Planning ------------------------------------------------------ The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) #5 is to provide industry with insight into the Government?s current plans.? The Government?is providing updates on the following topics and industry?is requested to provide?feedback as applicable:? Acquisition Strategy Updates Acquisition Schedule Aircraft Acceptability Criteria Evaluation Content & Criteria CLIN Structure Incentive Structure ------------------------------------------------------ Request for Information (RFI) #6 -The Government is providing updates on the following topic?and industry may provide feedback as applicable:?? ? ? ? 1. Capability and General Topic Questions for Industry ________________________________ The purpose of this?Request for Information (RFI) #7 is?to?provide industry with insight into the Government?s current digital program strategy and requirements, and to solicit industry feedback.? Industry responses will be used to continue maturing the Government?s approach to executing SAOC as a Digital Program.?? ________________________________ The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) #8 is to engage industry on topics related to Test and Evaluation (T&E) of the SAOC program. The Government would like information from industry regarding their T&E approach to better formulate an Integrated T&E strategy.? ________________________________ The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) #9 is to provide a?draft of the EMD Statement of Work (SOW) to?industry for feedback while the SAOC PMO continues with?efforts to complete sections and resolve?disconnects. ________________________________ The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) #10 is?to?release?a?draft?System Requirements Document (SRD) via classified media to interested companies holding the appropriate facility clearance. ________________________________ The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) #11?is to notify industry of a SAOC RFP update.? ________________________________ The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) #12 is to provide industry with a general update on the SAOC Program.? ________________________________ The purpose of this?Request for Information (RFI) #13 is?to?provide industry with the latest draft Development SOW for comment.? ________________________________ The purpose of this?Request for Information (RFI) #14 is?to?provide industry with insight into the Program?s current Government Reference Architecture (GRA) model and to solicit industry feedback. ________________________________ The purpose of this?Request for Information (RFI) #15 is?to release?a?draft?System Requirements Document (SRD) via classified media to interested companies holding the appropriate facility clearance. ________________________________ The purpose of this?Request for Information (RFI) #16 is?to provide industry with the latest draft ICS & Pro

category_id: Equipment: Aircraft Related Bids
title: Digital Vehicle Distribution Box (DVDB), Repair and Upgrade
description: NOTICE Type: Sources Sought / Market Research for Digital Vehicle Distribution Box (DVDB) Repair and Upgrade This is a SOURCES SOUGHT / MARKET RESEARCH notice to request information for Government planning purposes only. Responses will assist the Government in planning its acquisition strategy for a potential future acquisition. The Government is not committed to issue a solicitation or award a contract as a result of this announcement. ?Army Contracting Command - Detroit (ACC-DTA) is seeking qualified and capable potential vendors. ?Since this is a sources-sought synopsis and not a solicitation for receipt of proposals or quotations, the Government does not encourage questions concerning this market research. This Request for Information (RFI) is for the service of the DVDB (NSN: 5855-01-537-1406 PN:12484070 or NSN: 5855-01-588-5668? PN:12484070-1). The U.S. Army, Detroit Arsenal, is seeking prospective contractors for the Repair and Repair and Upgrade a Wired Housing Assembly otherwise known as the Digital Vehicle Distribution Box (DVDB) for the Bradley M2A3 and M3A3 platform. The Government does not own the technical data package for the DVDB. The DVDB assembly is a power distribution and control box for the automotive and diagnostic systems of the Bradley Fighting Vehicle. REQUESTED INFORMATION: The responses shall include the following information: Company a. Name: ________________________________________________________ b. Mailing Address: ________________________________________________________ c. Website: ________________________________________________________ Personnel Responding to RFI a. Name: ________________________________________________________ b. Title: ________________________________________________________ c. Company Responsibility/Position: ________________________________________________________ d. Telephone/Fax Numbers: ________________________________________________________ e. E-Mail Address: ________________________________________________________ f. CAGE (commercial and government entity) Code: ________________________________________________________ g. North America Industry Classification System (NAICS) number: ________________________________________________________ h. Business size and eligibility under USG social-economic programs and preference:? ________________________________________________________ i.? If your company is interested in responding to this RFI for the Repair and Repair/Upgrade of DVDBs, provide the following information: Explain how your company would repair DVDB Part Number 12484070-1 Revision T, to return them to Condition Code A. Explain how your company would upgrade DVDB P/N from 12484070 and 12484070-1 Rev ?S or lower to 12484070-1-Revision T and repair them to Condition Code A. Explain if your company has the capability at any time to repair and repair and upgrade up to a quantity of 336 each DVDBs per year at a rate of 28 each every 30 days for a 5 year period either constantly or intermittently (ie, break in production). Servicing a total of up to 1680 each. Explain if your company has experience with the Department of Defense (DoD) in Repair and Repair/Upgrade of the P/Ns listed above or DoD items similar to the Bradley DVDB (include contract numbers and award dates). Statements of your firm?s expertise should include reference to relevant contracts performed (including a description of the scope, quantity serviced, contract number, and point of contact with phone number). All interested firms and manufacturers, regardless of size, may respond to this request for information. Information submissions can include product literature and illustrations, relevant company background/experience.? Information submissions must be received no later than 10 days following posting of the RFI.? Responses should be addressed to Lisa Roulo, at the following address: lisa.r.roulo.civ@army.mil Again, this information is being requested for Government planning purposes only and does not commit the Government to any contractual agreement. This is not a request for proposals. The Government will not award a contract based upon responses to this announcement. The Government shall not reimburse or pay any costs for preparing or submitting information in response to this notice. Contracting Office Address: Army Contracting Command ? Detroit Arsenal ATTN: Lisa Roulo - CCTA-APS-C 6501 E. Eleven Mile Road, Warren, MI 48397-5000 Point of Contact(s): Lisa Roulo 586-282-4478

description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial products and commercial services prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.? This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; Offers are being requested and a written solicitation (paper copy) will not be issued.? Further, offerors are responsible for monitoring this site for the release of amendments (if any) or other information pertaining to this solicitation.? Solicitation FA875122Q0273 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2022-04 and Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement Publication Notice (DPN) 20220318. See https://www.acquisition.gov/ for the full text of all provisions and clauses incorporated by reference herein. This procurement is being issued as a Total Small Business Set-Aside under NAICS code 336411 and small business size standard of 1,500 employees. The contractor shall provide the items shown in the Chart (Attachment 1- Specs) on a Brand Name or Equal (BNOE) firm fixed price basis including the cost of shipping FOB Destination. The identified items reflect the physical, functional, and performance characteristics that reflect the characteristics and level of quality that will satisfy the minimum level of quality or reliability desired; however the offeror may provide a solution equivalent to or exceeding the functional and performance characteristics of the identified items and it will be considered for technical acceptability. The items listed may be offered on a "brand name or equal basis" pursuant to FAR 52.211-6; part numbers are provided for reference only. Technical information must be provided in sufficient detail to allow adequate and thorough technical evaluation of the proposed equal solution. Offerors shall provide at least the same warranty terms, including offers of extended warranties, offered to the general public in customary commercial practice. The anticipated delivery date is 10-12 weeks After Receipt of Order (ARO). All deliveries shall be made in accordance with FAR 52.247-34 FOB Destination. category_id: Equipment: Aircraft Related Bids
title: Establish new Indefinite Delivery / Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract for Fleet Response IV
description: The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) intends to negotiate a Cost Plus Fixed Fee (CPFF) Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract with a five-year ordering period on a sole source basis with Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (LM RMS) of Owego, NY. The IDIQ is for the procurement of supplies and services in support of the H-60 Helicopter Program, which includes all legacy aircraft and Foreign Military Sales (FMS) variants. This action is being negotiated and awarded on a sole source basis to LM RMS under the authority of a Justification and Approval (J&A) for Other Than Full and Open Competition, in accordance with FAR 6.302-1(a)(2)(iii), ?Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements. Specific performance requirements include, software support for upcoming MH-60R/S System Configurations, including the technical, management, and process support necessary to update and maintain MH-60R/S software, vendor software, maintenance-related software, laboratory support software, and Fleet Response Activity support services. Each order will have its own specific period of performance based on the requirement. The intended place of performance is the Contractor?s facility in ?Owego, New York. Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (LM RMS) is the sole designer, developer, and manufacturer of the MH-60R/S helicopter mission avionics suite, common cockpit, and all subsequent changes and improvements therein to the production aircraft. The Avionics Operational Program (AOP)?the software operating in the MH-60R/S mission computer?controls the operations, including the controls and displays of the helicopter (smart multi-functional displays (SMFD), Multi-Mode Radar (MMR), Flight Management Program (FMP), Data Fusion Program (DFP)), and interfaces with the algorithms residing in Electronic Support Measures (ESM) software. No other firm possess the required knowledge, experience, expertise, and proprietary technical and software data packages required to successfully fulfill these orders in a timely and cost effective manner. Responsible sources may submit a capability statement, which will be considered by the agency. Any statement must clearly demonstrate the capability to respond to this requirement without detriment to the H-60 Helicopter Program and must include personnel/resources specifically qualified to provide the supplies/services described. The capability statement must include the company?s approach to accomplish this effort in support of the H-60 Helicopter Program. This notice is not a request for proposals and does not imply or promise that the Government intends to award a contract vehicle as a result of this notice or in response to any capability statements received. The Government will not reimburse any costs incurred to prepare responses to this notice.

This order will?provide replenish equipment and spare parts in support of the TRIDENT II Fleet Ballistic?Missile/Strategic Weapons System (FBM/SWS) Navigation Equipment. Lockheed Martin is the only known source with the critical experience, expertise, personnel, facilities, and in-depth knowledge required to perform the subject effort.? ?

Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation (Cage Code 78286), under Basic Ordering Agreement SPE4A1-22-G-0005 for the items listed below. category_id: Equipment: Aircraft Related Bids
title: MH-65 Spare Parts
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR subpart 12.6 and part 13, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.? This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotations are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.? Solicitation number 70Z03822QB2000135 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ).? This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2022-04 Effective January 30, 2022. The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard Code is 336413.? The small business size standard is 1,250 employees. This is an unrestricted requirement. All responsible sources may submit a quotation which shall be considered by the agency.? It is anticipated that a firm-fixed price purchase order will be awarded on a competitive basis as a result of this synopsis/solicitation. All parts must have clear traceability to the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM)?s, Electronique Aerospatiale SA (Cage Code F2924). Traceability means a clear, complete, documented, and auditable paper trail which traces each step from an OEM or distributor to its current location.? See attached documents titled: ?Requirements - ?70Z03822QB2000135? and ?Terms and Conditions ? 70Z03822QB2000135?. 52.217-6 Option for Increased Quantity (MAR 1989) applies to this acquisition and is tailored as follows: The Government may increase the quantity (2 EA) of supplies called for in the Schedule by up to Four (4 EA), at the unit price specified, up to a maximum quantity of Six (6 EA).? The Contracting Officer may exercise the option by written notice to the Contractor within one calendar year after Purchase Order award.? Delivery of the added items shall continue at the same rate as the like items call for under the Purchase Order, unless the parties otherwise agree. ***Please note that if the USCG chooses to exercise any optional quantity modification, such modifications will be issued unilaterally to the contractor. (End of Clause) Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these items are invited to submit offers in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this solicitation.? Parts must be approved in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) guidelines to ensure safety of our aircrew.? The Government shall ensure all procurements are awarded without jeopardizing quality or safety of flight.? Only the use of airworthy commercial specifications or standard military specifications/military standard parts will be utilized and approved from this solicitation.? Newly manufactured commercial items will only be procured from sources able to provide a Certificate of Conformance (COC) and traceability to the OEM.? The Federal Aviation Regulation, Part 21, outlines certification procedures.? The contractor shall furnish a Certificate of Conformance (COC) in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) clause 52.246-15. Certificate of conformance must be submitted in the format specified in the clause.? All parts shall be NEW approved parts. Offerors must be able to provide necessary certification including traceability to the manufacturer, manufacturer's COC and its own COC to ensure parts are in airworthy condition, suitable for installation on USCG aircraft. ?Prospective vendors who are not the OEM or an authorized distributor must provide traceability for the offered product back to the manufacturer or authorized distributor. ?Traceability means a clear, complete, documented, and auditable paper trail which traces each step from an OEM or distributor to its current location.? NOTICE FOR FILING AGENCY PROTESTS United States Coast Guard Ombudsman Program It is the policy of the United States Coast Guard (USCG) to issue solicitations and make contract awards in a fair and timely manner. The Ombudsman Program for Agency Protests (OPAP) was established to investigate agency protest issues and resolve them without expensive and time- consuming litigation. OPAP is an independent reviewing authority that is empowered to grant a prevailing protester essentially the same relief as the Government Accountability Office (GAO). Interested parties are encouraged to seek resolution of their concerns within the USCG as an Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) forum rather than filing a protest with the GAO or some external forum. Interested parties may seek resolution of their concerns informally or opt to file a formal agency protest with the Contracting Officer or Ombudsman. Informal Forum with the Ombudsman. Interested parties who believe a specific USCG procurement is unfair or otherwise defective should first direct their concerns to the applicable Contracting Officer. If the Contracting Officer is unable to satisfy their concerns, interested parties are encouraged to contact the U.S. Coast Guard Ombudsman for Agency Protests. Under this informal process the agency is not required to suspend contract award performance.? Use of an informal forum does not suspend any time requirement for filing a protest with the agency or other forum. In order to ensure a timely response, interested parties should provide the following information to the Ombudsman: solicitation/contract number, contracting office, Contracting Officer, and solicitation closing date (if applicable). Formal Agency Protest with the Ombudsman. Prior to submitting a formal agency protest, protesters must first use their best efforts to resolve their concerns with the Contracting Officer through open and frank discussions. If the protester?s concerns are unresolved, an Independent Review is available by the Ombudsman.? The protester may file a formal agency protest to either the Contracting Officer or as an alternative to that, the Ombudsman under the OPAP program. Contract award or performance will be suspended during the protest period unless contract award or performance is justified, in writing, for urgent and compelling reasons or is determined in writing to be in the best interest of the Government.? The agency?s goal is to resolve protests in less than 35 calendar days from the date of filing. Protests shall include the information set forth in FAR 33.103(d) (2). If the protester fails to submit the required information, resolution of the protest may be delayed or the protest may be dismissed.? To be timely protests must be filed within the period specified in FAR 33.103(e).? Formal protests filed under the OPAP program should be submitted electronically to OPAP@uscg.mil and the Contracting Officer or by hand delivery to the Contracting Officer. Election of Forum. After an interested party protests a Coast Guard procurement to the Contracting Officer or the Ombudsman, and while the protest is pending, the protester agrees not to file a protest with the GAO or other external forum. If the protest is filed with an external forum, the agency protest will be dismissed.?

NOTICE FOR FILING AGENCY PROTESTS United States Coast Guard Ombudsman Program The Coast Guard Ombudsman Program for Agency Protests (OPAP). OPAP is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns informally within the Coast Guard as an Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. It is designed to resolve contractor protests in a faster, less expensive manner than could be accomplished at an external forum. Concerns of interested parties can be resolved through independent, Government binding adjudication taking place outside the procuring activity?s chain of command. Informal Forum with the Ombudsman. Interested parties who believe that a Coast Guard procurement is unfair or otherwise defective should first direct their concerns to the applicable Contracting Officer. This can be accomplished through informal discussion between the interested party and the Contracting Officer. During the course of such discussions Contracting Officers shall ensure that the Chief of the Contracting Office (COCO) remains informed of all issues and developments as they occur. If the Contracting Officer is unable to satisfy the concerns of the interested party, the interested party is encouraged to contact the Coast Guard Ombudsman for Agency Protest through the Ombudsman Hotline at (202) 372-3695. Under this informal process, the agency is not required to suspend contract award or performance. Use of an informal forum does not suspend any time requirements for filing an agency protest or protest with another forum. Interested parties should provide the following information to the Ombudsman in order to ensure a timely response: solicitation/contract number, contracting office, Contracting Officer, and solicitation closing date (if applicable). Formal Agency Protest with the Ombudsman. Prior to submitting a formal agency protest, contractors must first use their best efforts to resolve their concerns with the Contracting Officer through open and frank discussions. If the concerns cannot be resolved by the Contracting Officer, the Ombudsman may conduct an independent review through the informal forum. If the contractor?s concerns cannot be resolved informally, the contractor may file a Formal Agency Protest to either the Contracting Officer, or as an alternative, to the Ombudsman under the OPAP program. No contract award will be made pending resolution of the agency protest. Performance will be suspended during the protest period, if the protest is timely received in 10 days after contract award or within five days after a debriefing date offered to the protester following a timely debriefing request in accordance with the FAR 15.505 or 15.506. An award may be made or performance continued, however, if, justified by the HCA, in writing, for reasons of unusual and compelling urgency or determined by the HCA, in writing, to be in the best interest of the Government. The agency?s goal is to resolve protests in less than 35 calendar days from the date of filing. To be timely protests must be filed within the period specified in FAR 33.103(e). Formal protests filed under the OPAP program may be submitted electronically to OPAP@uscg.mil and the Contracting Officer or by hand delivery to the Contracting Officer. Election of Forum. After an interested party protests a Coast Guard procurement to the Contracting Officer or the Ombudsman, and while the protest is pending, the protester agrees not to file a protest with the GAO or other external forum. If the protest is filed with an external forum, the agency protest will be dismissed.

No alternate part numbers will be accepted. Parts must be approved in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) guidelines to ensure safety of our aircrew.? Best value to the Government is always the goal, but without jeopardizing quality or safety of flight.? NO SUBSTITUTE OR ALTERNATE PARTS WILL BE CONSIDERED.? ONLY NEW PARTS WILL BE ACCEPTED. NOTE: NO DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS OR SCHEMATICS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THIS AGENCY. Closing date and time for receipt of offers is 29 April 2022 at 5:00 pm EST.? Quotes and questions shall be submitted by email to Dane.W.Hobbs@uscg.mil. Please indicate solicitation 70Z03822QL0000063 in the subject line.? Phone calls WILL NOT be accepted. NOTICE FOR FILING AGENCY PROTESTS United States Coast Guard Ombudsman Program It is the policy of the United States Coast Guard (USCG) to issue solicitations and make contract awards in a fair and timely manner. The Ombudsman Program for Agency Protests (OPAP) was established to investigate agency protest issues and resolve them without expensive and time- consuming litigation. OPAP is an independent reviewing authority that is empowered to grant a prevailing protester essentially the same relief as the Government Accountability Office (GAO). Interested parties are encouraged to seek resolution of their concerns within the USCG as an Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) forum rather than filing a protest with the GAO or some external forum. Interested parties may seek resolution of their concerns informally or opt to file a formal agency protest with the Contracting Officer or Ombudsman. Informal Forum with the Ombudsman. Interested parties who believe a specific USCG procurement is unfair or otherwise defective should first direct their concerns to the applicable Contracting Officer. If the Contracting Officer is unable to satisfy their concerns, interested parties are encouraged to contact the U.S. Coast Guard Ombudsman for Agency Protests. Under this informal process the agency is not required to suspend contract award performance.? Use of an informal forum does not suspend any time requirement for filing a protest with the agency or other forum. In order to ensure a timely response, interested parties should provide the following information to the Ombudsman: solicitation/contract number, contracting office, Contracting Officer, and solicitation closing date (if applicable). Formal Agency Protest with the Ombudsman. Prior to submitting a formal agency protest, protesters must first use their best efforts to resolve their concerns with the Contracting Officer through open and frank discussions. If the protester?s concerns are unresolved, an Independent Review is available by the Ombudsman.? The protester may file a formal agency protest to either the Contracting Officer or as an alternative to that, the Ombudsman under the OPAP program. Contract award or performance will be suspended during the protest period unless contract award or performance is justified, in writing, for urgent and compelling reasons or is determined in writing to be in the best interest of the Government.? The agency?s goal is to resolve protests in less than 35 calendar days from the date of filing. Protests shall include the information set forth in FAR 33.103(d) (2). If the protester fails to submit the required information, resolution of the protest may be delayed or the protest may be dismissed.? To be timely protests must be filed within the period specified in FAR 33.103(e).? Formal protests filed under the OPAP program should be submitted electronically to OPAP@uscg.mil and the Contracting Officer or by hand delivery to the Contracting Officer. Election of Forum. After an interested party protests a Coast Guard procurement to the Contracting Officer or the Ombudsman, and while the protest is pending, the protester agrees not to file a protest with the GAO or other external forum. If the protest is filed with an external forum, the agency protest will be dismissed.?

Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation (Cage Code 78286), under Basic Ordering Agreement SPE4A1-22-G0005 for the item listed below. The statutory authority for this acquisition is 41 U.S.C 1901(c), as implemented in FAR 13.106-1 (b)(1). In accordance with FAR 13.106-1(b)(1), the items listed below are available from only one source. The North American Industry Classification System Code (NAICS) is 336413 with a size standard of 1,250 Employees. The Product Service Code (PSC) is 1560. The USCG desires early deliveries therefore early shipments are encouraged at no additional cost to the Government.? F.O.B. point is Origin.? Inspection and Acceptance under this contract will be performed at origin by Defense Contract Management Agency (DCMA). Solicitation number 70Z03822QJ0000040 is assigned for tracking purposes only.? No solicitation package will be issued. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive proposals; however, all responsible sources may submit a quotation to Michelle.R.Monds@uscg.mil and mrr-procurement@uscg.mil with 70Z03822QJ0000040 in the subject line which will be considered by the agency if received no later than 2:00 P.M., (EST) on 10 April 2022. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotations are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.? Solicitation number 70Z03822QJ0000092 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ).? This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2022-04 Effective January 30, 2022. The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard Code is 336413.? The small business size standard is 1,250 employees. This is an unrestricted requirement. All responsible sources may submit a quotation which shall be considered by the agency.? It is anticipated that a firm-fixed price Indefinite Delivery Requirements type contract consisting of one (1) one-year base period and four (4) one-year option periods shall be awarded as a result of this synopsis/solicitation.? All parts must have clear traceability to the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM)s, Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation (SAC) (78286) and TEK Precision Co., Ltd. (TEK) (65780). Traceability means a clear, complete, documented, and auditable paper trail which traces each step from an OEM or distributor to its current location. ? See attached documents titled: ?70Z03822QJ0000092 ? Attachment 1 - Schedule? and ?70Z03822QJ0000092 ? Attachment 2 ? Terms and Conditions? ??70Z03822QJ0000092 ? Attachment 3 ? Technical Acceptability Matrix?. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these items are invited to submit offers in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this solicitation.? Parts must be approved in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) guidelines to ensure safety of our aircrew.? The Government shall ensure all procurements are awarded without jeopardizing quality or safety of flight.? Only the use of airworthy commercial specifications or standard military specifications/military standard parts will be utilized and approved from this solicitation.? Newly manufactured commercial items will only be procured from sources able to provide a certificate of airworthiness, FAA 8130 (preferred) or equivalent European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) certification, or a Certificate of Conformance (COC) and traceability to the OEM.? The Federal Aviation Regulation, Part 21, outlines certification procedures.? The contractor shall furnish a Certificate of Conformance (COC) in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) clause 52.246-15. Certificate of conformance must be submitted in the format specified in the clause.? All parts shall be NEW approved parts. There are two OEMs associated with the parts contained within this solicitation. Offerors must be able to provide necessary certification including traceability to the manufacturer, manufacturer's COC and its own COC to ensure parts are in airworthy condition, suitable for installation on USCG aircraft. ?Prospective vendors who are not the OEM or an authorized distributor must provide traceability for the offered product back to the manufacturer or authorized distributor. ? Traceability means a clear, complete, documented, and auditable paper trail which traces each step from an OEM or distributor to its current location.? NOTE: NO DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS OR SCHEMATICS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THIS AGENCY. Closing date and time for receipt of offers is 06 June at 2:15 pm EST.? Quotes and questions shall be submitted by email to Emma.C.Craft@uscg.mil and Ashton.T.Roberson@uscg.mil.? Please indicate solicitation 70Z03822QJ0000092 in the subject line. Phone calls WILL NOT be accepted. NOTICE FOR FILING AGENCY PROTESTS United States Coast Guard Ombudsman Program It is the policy of the United States Coast Guard (USCG) to issue solicitations and make contract awards in a fair and timely manner. The Ombudsman Program for Agency Protests (OPAP) was established to investigate agency protest issues and resolve them without expensive and time- consuming litigation. OPAP is an independent reviewing authority that is empowered to grant a prevailing protester essentially the same relief as the Government Accountability Office (GAO). Interested parties are encouraged to seek resolution of their concerns within the USCG as an Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) forum rather than filing a protest with the GAO or some external forum. Interested parties may seek resolution of their concerns informally or opt to file a formal agency protest with the Contracting Officer or Ombudsman. Informal Forum with the Ombudsman. Interested parties who believe a specific USCG procurement is unfair or otherwise defective should first direct their concerns to the applicable Contracting Officer. If the Contracting Officer is unable to satisfy their concerns, interested parties are encouraged to contact the U.S. Coast Guard Ombudsman for Agency Protests. Under this informal process the agency is not required to suspend contract award performance.? Use of an informal forum does not suspend any time requirement for filing a protest with the agency or other forum. In order to ensure a timely response, interested parties should provide the following information to the Ombudsman: solicitation/contract number, contracting office, Contracting Officer, and solicitation closing date (if applicable). Formal Agency Protest with the Ombudsman. Prior to submitting a formal agency protest, protesters must first use their best efforts to resolve their concerns with the Contracting Officer through open and frank discussions. If the protester?s concerns are unresolved, an Independent Review is available by the Ombudsman.? The protester may file a formal agency protest to either the Contracting Officer or as an alternative to that, the Ombudsman under the OPAP program. Contract award or performance will be suspended during the protest period unless contract award or performance is justified, in writing, for urgent and compelling reasons or is determined in writing to be in the best interest of the Government.? The agency?s goal is to resolve protests in less than 35 calendar days from the date of filing. Protests shall include the information set forth in FAR 33.103(d) (2). If the protester fails to submit the required information, resolution of the protest may be delayed or the protest may be dismissed.? To be timely protests must be filed within the period specified in FAR 33.103(e).? Formal protests filed under the OPAP program should be submitted electronically to OPAP@uscg.mil and the Contracting Officer or by hand delivery to the Contracting Officer. Election of Forum. After an interested party protests a Coast Guard procurement to the Contracting Officer or the Ombudsman, and while the protest is pending, the protester agrees not to file a protest with the GAO or other external forum. If the protest is filed with an external forum, the agency protest will be dismissed

description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR subpart 12.6 and part 13, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.? This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotations are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.? Solicitation number 70Z03822QB2000145 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ).? This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2022-04 Effective January 30, 2022. The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard Code is 336413. The small business size standard is 1,250 employees. All responsible sources may submit a quotation which shall be considered by the agency.? It is anticipated that a firm-fixed price purchase order shall be awarded on a sole source basis to Airbus Helicopters, Inc. (AHI) as a result of this synopsis/solicitation. All parts must have clear traceability to the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), Airbus Helicopters France (Cage Code F0210).? Traceability means a clear, complete, documented, and auditable paper trail which traces each step from an OEM or an OEM authorized distributor to its current location. See attached documents titled: ?Requirements ? 70Z03822QB2000145,? and ?Terms and Conditions ? 70Z03822QB2000145? ?Redacted J and A ? 70Z03822QB2000145?. It is the Government's belief that AHI is the only known source to provide traceability, genuine OEM parts, and is the only OEM authorized distributor for Airbus Helicopters France parts required to successfully provide these items.? Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these items are invited to submit offers in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this solicitation. No alternate part numbers will be accepted. Parts must be approved in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) guidelines to ensure safety of our aircrew.? Best value to the Government is always the goal, but without jeopardizing quality or safety of flight.? Only the use of airworthy commercial specifications or standard military specifications/military standard parts will be utilized and approved from this solicitation.? Newly manufactured commercial items will only be procured from sources able to provide a Certificate of Conformance (COC) and traceability to the OEM.? The Federal Aviation Regulation, Part 21, outlines certification procedures.? The contractor shall furnish a COC in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) clause 52.246-15. COC must be submitted in the format specified in the clause.? All replacement parts shall be NEW approved parts. NO SUBSTITUTE OR ALTERNATE PARTS WILL BE CONSIDERED.? ONLY NEW PARTS WILL BE ACCEPTED. NOTE: NO DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS OR SCHEMATICS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THIS AGENCY. Closing date and time for receipt of offers is 29 April 2022 at 11:00 am EST.? Quotes and questions shall be submitted by email to kelly.s.raper@uscg.mil. Please indicate solicitation 70Z03822QB2000145 in the subject line.? Phone calls WILL NOT be accepted. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide these overhauls are invited to submit quotes in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this solicitation.? description: 1.? Procurement Type: Combined Synopsis/Solicitation 2.? Solicitation Number: 70Z03822QB2000005 3.? Title: Overhaul of Engine Cooling Fans 4.? Classification Code: 16 Aircraft Components and Accessoires 5.? Product Service Code (PSC)?: 1680 6.? NAICS Code: 336413 7.? Recover and Reinvestment Act Action: No 8.? Response Date: April 15, 2022 at 2:00 pm EST 9.? Primary Point of Contact:? Misty Bohn 10.? Secondary Point of Contact: Kathryn Lowe 11. Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR subpart 12.6 and subpart 13.5, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.? The applicable North American Industry Classification Standard Code is 336413. The small business size standard is 1,250 employees. This is an unrestricted solicitation. All responsible sources may submit a quotation which shall be considered by the agency.? The United States Coast Guard (USCG), Aviation Logistics Center (ALC), Elizabeth City, NC intends to award an Indefinite Delivery Requirements type contract on the basis of Other Than Full and Open Competition under FAR 13.501(a) to Safran Ventilation Systems USA, LLC for overhaul of Engine Cooling Fans. Overhaul of the fans will be serviced via issuance of individually funded task orders. Safran Ventilation Systems S.A.S France, (Cage Code F4957) is the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) of the part for this requirement. The only OEM authorized source of supply in North America is Saftran Ventilation Systems USA, LLC. It is anticipated that an Indefinite Delivery Requirements contract consisting of one (1) one-year base period and four (4) one-year option periods shall be awarded as a result of this synopsis/solicitation. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to overhaul the part are invited to submit offers in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this solicitation.
